messages: 46c4b11b8c698d537c9c3a4cc7cdcdc3 (13:35): hi there
a69c381f8abeee9190f77da3759bffa4 (13:39): kdevelop-3.3.3 looks for /usr/bin/qmake eventhough I told Qt3 with /usr/qt/3 in the project properties.
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (13:39): what does "which qmake" tell you?
00464406000479c74349daab494dd14d (13:50): paoleela, I had that problem too.  I use a script to set a new PATH and QTDIR before running kdevelop.
00464406000479c74349daab494dd14d (13:50): something like:  export PATH=/usr/local/Trolltech/Qt-4.1.3:$PATH
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (13:51): i think paoleela wants to use qt3
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (13:51): but gentoo puts it in some weird location and kdevelop doesn't find it
a69c381f8abeee9190f77da3759bffa4 (13:51): chakie_work, yes, exactly what gentoo does.
00464406000479c74349daab494dd14d (13:51): anyway, that should be:  export PATH=/usr/local/Trolltech/Qt-4.1.3/bin:$PATH
00464406000479c74349daab494dd14d (13:52): in case anyone else cares
a69c381f8abeee9190f77da3759bffa4 (13:52): pnoffke, doesn't it help to set a QTDIR globally?
00464406000479c74349daab494dd14d (13:52): I couldn't do it within kdevelop
00464406000479c74349daab494dd14d (13:53): But yeah, I also set my QTDIR to /usr/local/Trolltech/Qt-4.1.3 before running kdevelop
a69c381f8abeee9190f77da3759bffa4 (13:53): Ok, I see, QTDIR is already set to vers.3 but isn't used anyway.
00464406000479c74349daab494dd14d (13:53): but I think as long as the right qmake is run (with Qt4), QTDIR doesn't really matter
a69c381f8abeee9190f77da3759bffa4 (13:54): Or I just should switch to 4. But then I have to convert the exercises of Blanchettes Book vers. 3.
caacdffd7a4aa3937fabe8e185e5165e (13:54): i got one problem
caacdffd7a4aa3937fabe8e185e5165e (13:54): for (int i=0; i<plugins.count(); i++) printf("%d - %d\t", i, (uint)plugins[i]);
caacdffd7a4aa3937fabe8e185e5165e (13:54): loadSettings();
caacdffd7a4aa3937fabe8e185e5165e (13:55): and somewhere in the middle of "for (int i=0; i<plugins.count(); i++)" i get an message from loadSettings()
caacdffd7a4aa3937fabe8e185e5165e (13:55): ???
caacdffd7a4aa3937fabe8e185e5165e (13:55): why?
00464406000479c74349daab494dd14d (13:55): jtrip, what is your loadSettings function?
caacdffd7a4aa3937fabe8e185e5165e (13:56): starts with qDebug("Widget::loadSettings()");
caacdffd7a4aa3937fabe8e185e5165e (13:56): do i have to do a flush or what?
00464406000479c74349daab494dd14d (13:56): The way you've pasted your code, only the printf is in the loop.
caacdffd7a4aa3937fabe8e185e5165e (13:56): yap
caacdffd7a4aa3937fabe8e185e5165e (13:57): but i got message from ladSettings in the loop
caacdffd7a4aa3937fabe8e185e5165e (13:57): o.O
caacdffd7a4aa3937fabe8e185e5165e (13:58): heres a port of the output:
caacdffd7a4aa3937fabe8e185e5165e (13:58): 136 - 0 137 - 0 138 - 0139 - 0  140 - ZombieWidget::loadSettings()
caacdffd7a4aa3937fabe8e185e5165e (13:58): ZWidget::loadSettings()*
caacdffd7a4aa3937fabe8e185e5165e (13:59): part*
caacdffd7a4aa3937fabe8e185e5165e (13:59): damn :/

00464406000479c74349daab494dd14d (13:59): %d is not unsigned, but if uint is the same size as what %d takes, it may not matter.  Can you try replacing the printf with qDebug() just for a sanity check?
00464406000479c74349daab494dd14d (14:00): Yeah, then are you saying you get more messages from the loop after the loadSettings messages?
a69c381f8abeee9190f77da3759bffa4 (14:03): chakie_work, pnoffke: Because you also said it could be gentoo specific I forward to https://forums.gentoo.org/viewtopic-p-3390882.html#3390882
caacdffd7a4aa3937fabe8e185e5165e (14:05): works ok with qDebug
caacdffd7a4aa3937fabe8e185e5165e (14:05): :)
caacdffd7a4aa3937fabe8e185e5165e (14:05): but why?
caacdffd7a4aa3937fabe8e185e5165e (14:06): does that matter?
caacdffd7a4aa3937fabe8e185e5165e (14:07): QList<QObject *>
00464406000479c74349daab494dd14d (14:07): just wondering what the operator[] and typecast may be doing
00464406000479c74349daab494dd14d (14:08): could be a race condition between printf and qDebug().  Both write to stdout but flush at different times.
caacdffd7a4aa3937fabe8e185e5165e (14:10): anyway i'm going to using qDebug only
caacdffd7a4aa3937fabe8e185e5165e (14:10): so the problem is solved
00464406000479c74349daab494dd14d (14:12): I think it is when they are flushing.  I've seen this same problem when using std::cout and qDebug().
caacdffd7a4aa3937fabe8e185e5165e (14:23): f.write(data) f.flush(); f.close();
caacdffd7a4aa3937fabe8e185e5165e (14:23): why it doesn't do flush?
caacdffd7a4aa3937fabe8e185e5165e (14:23): it cuts the end of "data"
caacdffd7a4aa3937fabe8e185e5165e (14:23): :/
